title: 109_hr4844
content: The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires voters to provide photo identification. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates individuals to present photo identification when voting in person for Federal office. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires individuals to show government-issued photo identification when voting in person for Federal office. If not presented, individuals can use a provisional ballot. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates individuals to show government-issued photo ID when voting in person for Federal office. If not presented, individuals can use a provisional ballot, but must provide the required ID within 48 hours to be eligible to vote. Additionally, individuals voting other than in person must follow specific guidelines set by State or local election officials. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires individuals voting for Federal office to provide a government-issued photo ID, either in person or when voting by mail. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" mandates that individuals voting for Federal office must present a government-issued photo ID, except for overseas military voters on active duty. Specific requirements for identifications are outlined in the Act. The "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" requires individuals voting for Federal office to show a government-issued photo ID, with specific requirements for identification outlined in the Act. Amendments to the Act include defining what constitutes a government-issued ID and updating language regarding photo identification. Amendments to the "Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006" include updating the table of contents to reflect changes in section 303. Section 303 of the Federal Election Integrity Act of 2006 requires computerized statewide voter registration lists and photo identification for federal elections starting in November 2008. The amendment also mandates the provision of photo identification for all subsequent federal elections. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 amendment mandates states to provide photo identifications for individuals without government-issued IDs to vote in elections, starting in fiscal year 2008. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 amendment requires states to offer free photo identifications to indigent individuals for voting purposes, with fees not exceeding the state's cost. These IDs cannot be used for other government purposes. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 amendment mandates states to provide free photo IDs to indigent individuals for voting purposes only, not for other government functions. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 amendment requires states to provide free photo IDs to indigent individuals for voting purposes only. Part 7 covers payments to states for the costs of providing these IDs. The Commission will make payments to States to cover costs for providing photo identifications to individuals unable to afford fees under the program. The payment amount to a State will equal the fees that would have been collected but for certain provisions, based on information provided by the State. Authorization of appropriations is also included. Authorization of appropriations is granted for payments under this part for fiscal year 2008 and beyond. The effective date for this section and related amendments is October 1, 2007. Attest: KAREN L. HAAS, Clerk.
